intro: Scorodonia hircanica, commonly known as the goat's-beard, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces bulbous structures called corms, which serve as storage organs for nutrients. Scorodonia hircanica thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical research and horticultural cultivation.
